isis.stitle: EC-17 ANTILOCK TRACTION CONTROLLER - INSTALLING ACOM FOR WINDOWS SOFTWARE - GENERAL FOR ALL INSTALLATIONS

svcproc.title: GENERAL FOR ALL INSTALLATIONS
svcproc.para: To install ACom, you'll use the installation program called Setup.exe. Installation takes 5-10 minutes.

The following steps assume installation from drive A onto drive C. If the installation is to or from another drive or directory on a drive, substitute the path for the one given in the instructions. For example if ACom was copied from the disks to a directory on drive C called "copyacom," then skip Step 2 below and in Step 3 type C:\copyacom\setup.exe.

step1.para: Exit all programs, and turn off virus-detection and screen-saver software on your computer. This frees up memory for installation and prevents possible conflicts between the ACom 1.0 installer and other programs.
Insert ACom Disk 1 into drive A.
If ACom is being installed in Windows 3.X proceed to Step 4. If Windows 95 is in use go directly to Step 5.

This step is for installing on Windows 3.X. Under Program Manager click File and choose Run. Type A:\SETUP.EXE in the "Run" dialog box. Then click "OK." A "splash" screen or introductory screen will appear while the ACom Setup program prepares the InstallSh ield® Wizard to guide you through the balance of the installation. Proceed to Step 6.

This step is for installing on Windows 95. Click Start, and choose Run. Type A:\SETUP.EXE in the "Run" dialog box. Then click "OK." A "splash" screen or introductory screen will appear while the ACom Setup program prepares the InstallShield® Wizard to guide you through the balance of the installation. Proceed to Step 6.

svcproc.para: Alternatively click Start and choose Settings then Control Panel. In Control Panel double click Add/Remove Programs and click Install, then Next in the installation Wizard. A:\SETUP.EXE should appear in the dialog box. If not, type in the location of the ACom program then click Finish. Proceed to Step 6.

step1.para: Once the Wizard has been installed, a Welcome dialog box appears and a dialog box cautions that all programs should be closed before proceeding. Click Cancel if all programs have not already been closed, otherwise click Next.

figure.caption: Figure 11. Click Next if All Programs are Closed

step1.para: The next dialog box that appears is the license agreement. Read the agreement. If you agree with the terms, click Yes to proceed. Click No to terminate the installation.
ACom creates directory C:\Allied\ACom4win by default. If you do not want to use this default destination directory use the Browse button to specify the destination you want and then click Next.
ACom Setup will create a Program Group called "ACom For Windows" and install icons. You may select another program group if desired. Click Next to proceed.

figure.caption: Figure 14. ACom for Windows Program Group

step1.para: Select program folder - Arrow down in the existing folders and choose "Vehicle Diagnostics" ( Figure 14).

Setup will begin copying ACom program files ( Figure 15). Refer to Figure 7. Sometime during this phase of the installation Setup will ask that disk 1 be removed and disk 2 to be inserted (this assumes that installation is made from disks). If the installation is being made from a directory created when copying both disks, then the installation will proceed until complete ( Figure 16).

figure.caption: Figure 15. Setup Will Begin Copying ACom Program Files
Figure 16. Installation Will Proceed Until Complete

step1.para: After the setup routine has completed copying the files to the computer hard drive, a preliminary antilock system setup dialog box will appear. If the information requested by this dialog box is unknown, click the "X" in the upper right corner of the window and continue. For more information see the ACom File Menu section of this manual and the ACom help system ( Figure 17).
After Setup has completed the installation of ACom, click Finish in the final screen ( Figure 18).

figure.caption: Figure 18. Click Finish in Final Screen

step1.para: The Program Group (Windows 3.X) or Folder (Windows 95) installed by ACom contains the ACom Program and Uninstall icons ( Figure 19).

figure.caption: Figure 19. ACom Program and Uninstall Icons

note.para: Refer to Figure 19 for a Windows 95 Folder. The appearance of a Program Group in Windows 3.X would be similar.

important.para: Windows 95 users should drag both icons to the desktop or to the directory where ACom For Windows is installed (the default directory from the installation wizard is C:\Allied\ACom4win).

svcproc.para: Windows 3.X users can Maximize or Minimize the ACom For Windows program group to access either program.

step1.para: Install #3 disk - choose start, then run. A: Install will appear; choose OK.

svcproc.para: Your ACom for Windows Icon is now installed under "Vehicle Diagnostics" folder on the desktop.
